import hashlib 
def generate_hash(message):
    hash_object = hashlib.sha256(message.encode())
    return hash_object.hexdigest()

/*# User Input
user_input = input("Enter a message to hash: ")
hash_value = generate_hash(user_input)
print("Hash Value:", hash_value)

from Crypto.PublicKey import RSA
from Crypto.Signature import pkcs1_15
from Crypto.Hash import SHA256

# Generate RSA key pair
key = RSA.generate(2048)

# Sender (Alice) signs the message
message = b"Hello Bob, this message is signed by Alice."
hash_message = SHA256.new(message)
signature = pkcs1_15.new(key).sign(hash_message)

# Receiver (Bob) verifies the signature
verifier = pkcs1_15.new(key.publickey())

try:
    verifier.verify(hash_message, signature)
    print("Digital Signature Verified: Message is Authentic.")
except (ValueError, TypeError):
    print("Digital Signature Verification Failed: Message may have been tampered.”)*/## Student Name: Venkata Vineetha Gandredu
## Student ID: 1230643650
## Date: 1st November 2023

import hashlib 
def generate_hash(message):
    hash_object = hashlib.sha256(message.encode())
    return hash_object.hexdigest()

# User Input
user_input = input("Enter a message to hash: ")
hash_value = generate_hash(user_input)
print("Hash Value:", hash_value)

from Crypto.PublicKey import RSA
from Crypto.Signature import pkcs1_15
from Crypto.Hash import SHA256

# Generate RSA key pair
key = RSA.generate(2048)

# Sender (Alice) signs the message
message = b"Hello Bob, this message is signed by Alice."
hash_message = SHA256.new(message)
signature = pkcs1_15.new(key).sign(hash_message)

# Receiver (Bob) verifies the signature
verifier = pkcs1_15.new(key.publickey())

try:
    verifier.verify(hash_message, signature)
    print("Digital Signature Verified: Message is Authentic.")
except (ValueError, TypeError):
    print("Digital Signature Verification Failed: Message may have been tampered.")
## Student Name: Venkata Vineetha Gandredu

import hashlib 
def generate_hash(message):
    hash_object = hashlib.sha256(message.encode())
    return hash_object.hexdigest()

# User Input
user_input = input("Enter a message to hash: ")
hash_value = generate_hash(user_input)
print("Hash Value:", hash_value)

from Crypto.PublicKey import RSA
from Crypto.Signature import pkcs1_15
from Crypto.Hash import SHA256

# Generate RSA key pair
key = RSA.generate(2048)

# Sender (Alice) signs the message
message = b"Hello Bob, this message is signed by Alice."
hash_message = SHA256.new(message)
signature = pkcs1_15.new(key).sign(hash_message)

# Receiver (Bob) verifies the signature
verifier = pkcs1_15.new(key.publickey())

try:
    verifier.verify(hash_message, signature)
    print("Digital Signature Verified: Message is Authentic.")
except (ValueError, TypeError):
    print("Digital Signature Verification Failed: Message may have been tampered.")

import hashlib 
def generate_hash(message):
    hash_object = hashlib.sha256(message.encode())
    return hash_object.hexdigest()

# User Input
user_input = input("Enter a message to hash: ")
hash_value = generate_hash(user_input)
print("Hash Value:", hash_value)

from Crypto.PublicKey import RSA
from Crypto.Signature import pkcs1_15
from Crypto.Hash import SHA256

# Generate RSA key pair
key = RSA.generate(2048)

# Sender (Alice) signs the message
message = b"Hello Bob, this message is signed by Alice."
hash_message = SHA256.new(message)
signature = pkcs1_15.new(key).sign(hash_message)

# Receiver (Bob) verifies the signature
verifier = pkcs1_15.new(key.publickey())

try:
    verifier.verify(hash_message, signature)
    print("Digital Signature Verified: Message is Authentic.")
except (ValueError, TypeError):
    print("Digital Signature Verification Failed: Message may have been tampered.")

import hashlib 
def generate_hash(message):
    hash_object = hashlib.sha256(message.encode())
    return hash_object.hexdigest()

# User Input
user_input = input("Enter a message to hash: ")
hash_value = generate_hash(user_input)
print("Hash Value:", hash_value)

from Crypto.PublicKey import RSA
from Crypto.Signature import pkcs1_15
from Crypto.Hash import SHA256

# Generate RSA key pair
key = RSA.generate(2048)

# Sender (Alice) signs the message
message = b"Hello Bob, this message is signed by Alice."
hash_message = SHA256.new(message)
signature = pkcs1_15.new(key).sign(hash_message)

# Receiver (Bob) verifies the signature
verifier = pkcs1_15.new(key.publickey())

try:
    verifier.verify(hash_message, signature)
    print("Digital Signature Verified: Message is Authentic.")
except (ValueError, TypeError):
    print("Digital Signature Verification Failed: Message may have been tampered.")

import hashlib 
def generate_hash(message):
    hash_object = hashlib.sha256(message.encode())
    return hash_object.hexdigest()

# User Input
user_input = input("Enter a message to hash: ")
hash_value = generate_hash(user_input)
print("Hash Value:", hash_value)

from Crypto.PublicKey import RSA
from Crypto.Signature import pkcs1_15
from Crypto.Hash import SHA256

# Generate RSA key pair
key = RSA.generate(2048)

# Sender (Alice) signs the message
message = b"Hello Bob, this message is signed by Alice."
hash_message = SHA256.new(message)
signature = pkcs1_15.new(key).sign(hash_message)

# Receiver (Bob) verifies the signature
verifier = pkcs1_15.new(key.publickey())

try:
    verifier.verify(hash_message, signature)
    print("Digital Signature Verified: Message is Authentic.")
except (ValueError, TypeError):
    print("Digital Signature Verification Failed: Message may have been tampered.")

import hashlib 
def generate_hash(message):
    hash_object = hashlib.sha256(message.encode())
    return hash_object.hexdigest()

# User Input
user_input = input("Enter a message to hash: ")
hash_value = generate_hash(user_input)
print("Hash Value:", hash_value)

from Crypto.PublicKey import RSA
from Crypto.Signature import pkcs1_15
from Crypto.Hash import SHA256

# Generate RSA key pair
key = RSA.generate(2048)

# Sender (Alice) signs the message
message = b"Hello Bob, this message is signed by Alice."
hash_message = SHA256.new(message)
signature = pkcs1_15.new(key).sign(hash_message)

# Receiver (Bob) verifies the signature
verifier = pkcs1_15.new(key.publickey())

try:
    verifier.verify(hash_message, signature)
    print("Digital Signature Verified: Message is Authentic.")
except (ValueError, TypeError):
    print("Digital Signature Verification Failed: Message may have been tampered.")

from Crypto.Signature import pkcs1_15
from Crypto.Hash import SHA256

# Generate RSA key pair
key = RSA.generate(2048)

# Sender (Alice) signs the message
message = b"Hello Bob, this message is signed by Alice."
hash_message = SHA256.new(message)
signature = pkcs1_15.new(key).sign(hash_message)

# Receiver (Bob) verifies the signature
verifier = pkcs1_15.new(key.publickey())

try:
    verifier.verify(hash_message, signature)
    print("Digital Signature Verified: Message is Authentic.")
except (ValueError, TypeError):
    print("Digital Signature Verification Failed: Message may have been tampered.")

from Crypto.Signature import pkcs1_15
from Crypto.Hash import SHA256

from Crypto.Signature import pkcs1_15
from Crypto.Hash import SHA256

# Sender (Alice) signs the message

def generate_hash(message):
    hash_object = hashlib.sha256(message.encode())

from Crypto.PublicKey import RSA
from Crypto.Signature import pkcs1_15
from Crypto.Hash import SHA256

# Generate RSA key pair
key = RSA.generate(2048)

# Sender (Alice) signs the message
message = b"Hello Bob, this message is signed by Alice."
hash_message = SHA256.new(message)
signature = pkcs1_15.new(key).sign(hash_message)

# Receiver (Bob) verifies the signature
verifier = pkcs1_15.new(key.publickey())

try:
    verifier.verify(hash_message, signature)
    print("Digital Signature Verified: Message is Authentic.")
except (ValueError, TypeError):
    print("Digital Signature Verification Failed: Message may have been tampered.")
## Student Name: Venkata Vineetha Gandredu

import hashlib 
def generate_hash(message):
    hash_object = hashlib.sha256(message.encode())
    return hash_object.hexdigest()

# User Input
user_input = input("Enter a message to hash: ")
hash_value = generate_hash(user_input)
print("Hash Value:", hash_value)

from Crypto.PublicKey import RSA
from Crypto.Signature import pkcs1_15
from Crypto.Hash import SHA256

# Generate RSA key pair
key = RSA.generate(2048)

# Sender (Alice) signs the message
message = b"Hello Bob, this message is signed by Alice."
hash_message = SHA256.new(message)
signature = pkcs1_15.new(key).sign(hash_message)

# Receiver (Bob) verifies the signature
verifier = pkcs1_15.new(key.publickey())

try:
    verifier.verify(hash_message, signature)
    print("Digital Signature Verified: Message is Authentic.")
except (ValueError, TypeError):
    print("Digital Signature Verification Failed: Message may have been tampered.")
## Student Name: Venkata Vineetha Gandredu
## Student ID: 1230643650
## Date: 1st November 2023

import hashlib 
def generate_hash(message):
    hash_object = hashlib.sha256(message.encode())
    return hash_object.hexdigest()

# User Input
user_input = input("Enter a message to hash: ")
hash_value = generate_hash(user_input)
print("Hash Value:", hash_value)

from Crypto.PublicKey import RSA
from Crypto.Signature import pkcs1_15
from Crypto.Hash import SHA256

# Generate RSA key pair
key = RSA.generate(2048)

# Sender (Alice) signs the message
message = b"Hello Bob, this message is signed by Alice."
hash_message = SHA256.new(message)
signature = pkcs1_15.new(key).sign(hash_message)

# Receiver (Bob) verifies the signature
verifier = pkcs1_15.new(key.publickey())

try:
    verifier.verify(hash_message, signature)
    print("Digital Signature Verified: Message is Authentic.")
except (ValueError, TypeError):
    print("Digital Signature Verification Failed: Message may have been tampered.")

from Crypto.PublicKey import RSA
from Crypto.Signature import pkcs1_15
from Crypto.Hash import SHA256

# Generate RSA key pair
key = RSA.generate(2048)

# Sender (Alice) signs the message
message = b"Hello Bob, this message is signed by Alice."
hash_message = SHA256.new(message)
signature = pkcs1_15.new(key).sign(hash_message)

# Receiver (Bob) verifies the signature
verifier = pkcs1_15.new(key.publickey())

try:
    verifier.verify(hash_message, signature)
    print("Digital Signature Verified: Message is Authentic.")
except (ValueError, TypeError):
    print("Digital Signature Verification Failed: Message may have been tampered.")



## Student Name: Venkata Vineetha Gandredu
## Student ID: 1230643650
## Date: 1st November 2023

import hashlib 
def generate_hash(message):
    hash_object = hashlib.sha256(message.encode())
    return hash_object.hexdigest()

# User Input
user_input = input("Enter a message to hash: ")
hash_value = generate_hash(user_input)
print("Hash Value:", hash_value)

from Crypto.PublicKey import RSA
from Crypto.Signature import pkcs1_15
from Crypto.Hash import SHA256

# Generate RSA key pair
key = RSA.generate(2048)

# Sender (Alice) signs the message
message = b"Hello Bob, this message is signed by Alice."
hash_message = SHA256.new(message)
signature = pkcs1_15.new(key).sign(hash_message)

# Receiver (Bob) verifies the signature
verifier = pkcs1_15.new(key.publickey())

try:
    verifier.verify(hash_message, signature)
    print("Digital Signature Verified: Message is Authentic.")
except (ValueError, TypeError):
    print("Digital Signature Verification Failed: Message may have been tampered.")

from Crypto.PublicKey import RSA
from Crypto.Signature import pkcs1_15
from Crypto.Hash import SHA256

# Generate RSA key pair
key = RSA.generate(2048)

# Sender (Alice) signs the message
message = b"Hello Bob, this message is signed by Alice."
hash_message = SHA256.new(message)
signature = pkcs1_15.new(key).sign(hash_message)

# Receiver (Bob) verifies the signature
verifier = pkcs1_15.new(key.publickey())

try:
    verifier.verify(hash_message, signature)
    print("Digital Signature Verified: Message is Authentic.")
except (ValueError, TypeError):
    print("Digital Signature Verification Failed: Message may have been tampered.")
## Student Name: Venkata Vineetha Gandredu
## Student ID: 1230643650
## Date: 1st November 2023

import hashlib 
def generate_hash(message):
    hash_object = hashlib.sha256(message.encode())
    return hash_object.hexdigest()

# User Input
user_input = input("Enter a message to hash: ")
hash_value = generate_hash(user_input)
print("Hash Value:", hash_value)

from Crypto.Signature import pkcs1_15
from Crypto.Hash import SHA256

    print("Digital Signature Verified: Message is Authentic.")
except (ValueError, TypeError):
    print("Digital Signature Verification Failed: Message may have been tampered.")

    return hash_object.hexdigest()

## Student Name: Venkata Vineetha Gandredu
## Student ID: 1230643650
## Date: 1st November 2023

import hashlib 
def generate_hash(message):
    hash_object = hashlib.sha256(message.encode())
    return hash_object.hexdigest()

# User Input
user_input = input("Enter a message to hash: ")
hash_value = generate_hash(user_input)
print("Hash Value:", hash_value)

from Crypto.PublicKey import RSA
from Crypto.Signature import pkcs1_15
from Crypto.Hash import SHA256

# Generate RSA key pair
key = RSA.generate(2048)

# Sender (Alice) signs the message
message = b"Hello Bob, this message is signed by Alice."
hash_message = SHA256.new(message)
signature = pkcs1_15.new(key).sign(hash_message)

# Receiver (Bob) verifies the signature
verifier = pkcs1_15.new(key.publickey())

try:
    verifier.verify(hash_message, signature)
    print("Digital Signature Verified: Message is Authentic.")
except (ValueError, TypeError):
    print("Digital Signature Verification Failed: Message may have been tampered.")

## Student Name: Venkata Vineetha Gandredu

import hashlib 
def generate_hash(message):
    hash_object = hashlib.sha256(message.encode())
    return hash_object.hexdigest()

# User Input

from Crypto.PublicKey import RSA
from Crypto.Signature import pkcs1_15
from Crypto.Hash import SHA256

# Generate RSA key pair
key = RSA.generate(2048)

# Sender (Alice) signs the message
message = b"Hello Bob, this message is signed by Alice."
hash_message = SHA256.new(message)
signature = pkcs1_15.new(key).sign(hash_message)

# Receiver (Bob) verifies the signature
verifier = pkcs1_15.new(key.publickey())

try:
    verifier.verify(hash_message, signature)
    print("Digital Signature Verified: Message is Authentic.")
except (ValueError, TypeError):
    print("Digital Signature Verification Failed: Message may have been tampered.")



## Student Name: Venkata Vineetha Gandredu
## Student ID: 1230643650
## Date: 1st November 2023

import hashlib 
def generate_hash(message):
    hash_object = hashlib.sha256(message.encode())
    return hash_object.hexdigest()

# User Input
user_input = input("Enter a message to hash: ")
hash_value = generate_hash(user_input)
print("Hash Value:", hash_value)

from Crypto.PublicKey import RSA
from Crypto.Signature import pkcs1_15
from Crypto.Hash import SHA256

# Generate RSA key pair
key = RSA.generate(2048)

# Sender (Alice) signs the message
message = b"Hello Bob, this message is signed by Alice."
hash_message = SHA256.new(message)
signature = pkcs1_15.new(key).sign(hash_message)

# Receiver (Bob) verifies the signature
verifier = pkcs1_15.new(key.publickey())

try:
    verifier.verify(hash_message, signature)
    print("Digital Signature Verified: Message is Authentic.")
except (ValueError, TypeError):
    print("Digital Signature Verification Failed: Message may have been tampered.")

import hashlib

from Crypto.PublicKey import RSA
from Crypto.Signature import pkcs1_15
from Crypto.Hash import SHA256

# Generate RSA key pair
key = RSA.generate(2048)

# Sender (Alice) signs the message
message = b"Hello Bob, this message is signed by Alice."
hash_message = SHA256.new(message)
signature = pkcs1_15.new(key).sign(hash_message)

# Receiver (Bob) verifies the signature
verifier = pkcs1_15.new(key.publickey())

try:
    verifier.verify(hash_message, signature)
    print("Digital Signature Verified: Message is Authentic.")
except (ValueError, TypeError):
    print("Digital Signature Verification Failed: Message may have been tampered.")
## Student Name: Venkata Vineetha Gandredu
## Student ID: 1230643650
## Date: 1st November 2023

import hashlib 
def generate_hash(message):
    hash_object = hashlib.sha256(message.encode())
    return hash_object.hexdigest()

# User Input
user_input = input("Enter a message to hash: ")
hash_value = generate_hash(user_input)
print("Hash Value:", hash_value)

from Crypto.PublicKey import RSA
from Crypto.Signature import pkcs1_15
from Crypto.Hash import SHA256

# Generate RSA key pair
key = RSA.generate(2048)

# Sender (Alice) signs the message
message = b"Hello Bob, this message is signed by Alice."
hash_message = SHA256.new(message)
signature = pkcs1_15.new(key).sign(hash_message)

# Receiver (Bob) verifies the signature
verifier = pkcs1_15.new(key.publickey())

try:
    verifier.verify(hash_message, signature)
    print("Digital Signature Verified: Message is Authentic.")
except (ValueError, TypeError):
    print("Digital Signature Verification Failed: Message may have been tampered.")

/*# User Input

from Crypto.PublicKey import RSA
from Crypto.Signature import pkcs1_15
from Crypto.Hash import SHA256

# Generate RSA key pair
key = RSA.generate(2048)

# Sender (Alice) signs the message
message = b"Hello Bob, this message is signed by Alice."
hash_message = SHA256.new(message)
signature = pkcs1_15.new(key).sign(hash_message)

# Receiver (Bob) verifies the signature
verifier = pkcs1_15.new(key.publickey())

try:
    verifier.verify(hash_message, signature)
    print("Digital Signature Verified: Message is Authentic.")
except (ValueError, TypeError):
    print("Digital Signature Verification Failed: Message may have been tampered.”)*/## Student Name: Venkata Vineetha Gandredu
## Student ID: 1230643650
## Date: 1st November 2023

import hashlib 
def generate_hash(message):
    hash_object = hashlib.sha256(message.encode())
    return hash_object.hexdigest()

# User Input
user_input = input("Enter a message to hash: ")
hash_value = generate_hash(user_input)
print("Hash Value:", hash_value)

from Crypto.PublicKey import RSA
from Crypto.Signature import pkcs1_15
from Crypto.Hash import SHA256

# Generate RSA key pair
key = RSA.generate(2048)

# Sender (Alice) signs the message
message = b"Hello Bob, this message is signed by Alice."
hash_message = SHA256.new(message)
signature = pkcs1_15.new(key).sign(hash_message)

# Receiver (Bob) verifies the signature
verifier = pkcs1_15.new(key.publickey())

try:
    verifier.verify(hash_message, signature)
    print("Digital Signature Verified: Message is Authentic.")
except (ValueError, TypeError):
    print("Digital Signature Verification Failed: Message may have been tampered.")

import hashlib 
def generate_hash(message):
    hash_object = hashlib.sha256(message.encode())
    return hash_object.hexdigest()

# User Input
user_input = input("Enter a message to hash: ")
hash_value = generate_hash(user_input)
print("Hash Value:", hash_value)

from Crypto.PublicKey import RSA
from Crypto.Signature import pkcs1_15
from Crypto.Hash import SHA256

# Generate RSA key pair
key = RSA.generate(2048)

# Sender (Alice) signs the message
message = b"Hello Bob, this message is signed by Alice."
hash_message = SHA256.new(message)
signature = pkcs1_15.new(key).sign(hash_message)

# Receiver (Bob) verifies the signature
verifier = pkcs1_15.new(key.publickey())

try:
    verifier.verify(hash_message, signature)
    print("Digital Signature Verified: Message is Authentic.")
except (ValueError, TypeError):
    print("Digital Signature Verification Failed: Message may have been tampered.")

from Crypto.Signature import pkcs1_15
from Crypto.Hash import SHA256

# Generate RSA key pair

# Sender (Alice) signs the message
message = b"Hello Bob, this message is signed by Alice."
hash_message = SHA256.new(message)
signature = pkcs1_15.new(key).sign(hash_message)

# Receiver (Bob) verifies the signature

    verifier.verify(hash_message, signature)

except (ValueError, TypeError):
    print("Digital Signature Verification Failed: Message may have been tampered.")

## Student Name: Venkata Vineetha Gandredu
## Student ID: 1230643650
## Date: 1st November 2023

import hashlib 
def generate_hash(message):
    hash_object = hashlib.sha256(message.encode())
    return hash_object.hexdigest()

# User Input
user_input = input("Enter a message to hash: ")
hash_value = generate_hash(user_input)
print("Hash Value:", hash_value)

from Crypto.PublicKey import RSA
from Crypto.Signature import pkcs1_15
from Crypto.Hash import SHA256

# Generate RSA key pair
key = RSA.generate(2048)

# Sender (Alice) signs the message
message = b"Hello Bob, this message is signed by Alice."
hash_message = SHA256.new(message)
signature = pkcs1_15.new(key).sign(hash_message)

# Receiver (Bob) verifies the signature
verifier = pkcs1_15.new(key.publickey())

try:
    verifier.verify(hash_message, signature)
    print("Digital Signature Verified: Message is Authentic.")
except (ValueError, TypeError):
    print("Digital Signature Verification Failed: Message may have been tampered.")

## Student Name: Venkata Vineetha Gandredu
## Student ID: 1230643650
## Date: 1st November 2023

    return hash_object.hexdigest()

print("Hash Value:", hash_value)

## Student Name: Venkata Vineetha Gandredu
## Student ID: 1230643650
## Date: 1st November 2023

import hashlib 
def generate_hash(message):
    hash_object = hashlib.sha256(message.encode())
    return hash_object.hexdigest()

# User Input
user_input = input("Enter a message to hash: ")
hash_value = generate_hash(user_input)
print("Hash Value:", hash_value)

from Crypto.PublicKey import RSA
from Crypto.Signature import pkcs1_15
from Crypto.Hash import SHA256

# Generate RSA key pair
key = RSA.generate(2048)

# Sender (Alice) signs the message
message = b"Hello Bob, this message is signed by Alice."
hash_message = SHA256.new(message)
signature = pkcs1_15.new(key).sign(hash_message)

# Receiver (Bob) verifies the signature
verifier = pkcs1_15.new(key.publickey())

try:
    verifier.verify(hash_message, signature)
    print("Digital Signature Verified: Message is Authentic.")
except (ValueError, TypeError):
    print("Digital Signature Verification Failed: Message may have been tampered.")
## Student Name: Venkata Vineetha Gandredu
## Student ID: 1230643650
## Date: 1st November 2023

import hashlib 
def generate_hash(message):
    hash_object = hashlib.sha256(message.encode())

# User Input

from Crypto.PublicKey import RSA
from Crypto.Signature import pkcs1_15
from Crypto.Hash import SHA256

# Generate RSA key pair
key = RSA.generate(2048)

# Sender (Alice) signs the message
message = b"Hello Bob, this message is signed by Alice."
hash_message = SHA256.new(message)
signature = pkcs1_15.new(key).sign(hash_message)

# Receiver (Bob) verifies the signature
verifier = pkcs1_15.new(key.publickey())

try:
    verifier.verify(hash_message, signature)
    print("Digital Signature Verified: Message is Authentic.")
except (ValueError, TypeError):
    print("Digital Signature Verification Failed: Message may have been tampered.")
## Student Name: Venkata Vineetha Gandredu
## Student ID: 1230643650
## Date: 1st November 2023

import hashlib 
def generate_hash(message):
    hash_object = hashlib.sha256(message.encode())
    return hash_object.hexdigest()

# User Input
user_input = input("Enter a message to hash: ")
hash_value = generate_hash(user_input)
print("Hash Value:", hash_value)

from Crypto.PublicKey import RSA
from Crypto.Signature import pkcs1_15
from Crypto.Hash import SHA256

# Generate RSA key pair
key = RSA.generate(2048)

# Sender (Alice) signs the message
message = b"Hello Bob, this message is signed by Alice."
hash_message = SHA256.new(message)
signature = pkcs1_15.new(key).sign(hash_message)

# Receiver (Bob) verifies the signature
verifier = pkcs1_15.new(key.publickey())

try:
    verifier.verify(hash_message, signature)
    print("Digital Signature Verified: Message is Authentic.")
except (ValueError, TypeError):
    print("Digital Signature Verification Failed: Message may have been tampered.")
## Student Name: Venkata Vineetha Gandredu
## Student ID: 1230643650
## Date: 1st November 2023

message = b"Hello Bob, this message is signed by Alice."
hash_message = SHA256.new(message)
signature = pkcs1_15.new(key).sign(hash_message)

# Receiver (Bob) verifies the signature
verifier = pkcs1_15.new(key.publickey())

try:
    verifier.verify(hash_message, signature)
    print("Digital Signature Verified: Message is Authentic.")
except (ValueError, TypeError):
    print("Digital Signature Verification Failed: Message may have been tampered.”)*/## Student Name: Venkata Vineetha Gandredu
## Student ID: 1230643650
## Date: 1st November 2023

import hashlib 
def generate_hash(message):
    hash_object = hashlib.sha256(message.encode())
    return hash_object.hexdigest()

# User Input
user_input = input("Enter a message to hash: ")
hash_value = generate_hash(user_input)
print("Hash Value:", hash_value)

from Crypto.PublicKey import RSA
from Crypto.Signature import pkcs1_15
from Crypto.Hash import SHA256

# Generate RSA key pair
key = RSA.generate(2048)

# Sender (Alice) signs the message
message = b"Hello Bob, this message is signed by Alice."
hash_message = SHA256.new(message)
signature = pkcs1_15.new(key).sign(hash_message)

# Receiver (Bob) verifies the signature
verifier = pkcs1_15.new(key.publickey())

try:
    verifier.verify(hash_message, signature)
    print("Digital Signature Verified: Message is Authentic.")
except (ValueError, TypeError):
    print("Digital Signature Verification Failed: Message may have been tampered.")

from Crypto.PublicKey import RSA
from Crypto.Signature import pkcs1_15
from Crypto.Hash import SHA256

# Generate RSA key pair
key = RSA.generate(2048)

# Sender (Alice) signs the message
message = b"Hello Bob, this message is signed by Alice."
hash_message = SHA256.new(message)
signature = pkcs1_15.new(key).sign(hash_message)

# Receiver (Bob) verifies the signature
verifier = pkcs1_15.new(key.publickey())

try:
    verifier.verify(hash_message, signature)
    print("Digital Signature Verified: Message is Authentic.")
except (ValueError, TypeError):
    print("Digital Signature Verification Failed: Message may have been tampered.")

## Student Name: Venkata Vineetha Gandredu
## Student ID: 1230643650
## Date: 1st November 2023

import hashlib 
def generate_hash(message):
    hash_object = hashlib.sha256(message.encode())
    return hash_object.hexdigest()

# User Input
user_input = input("Enter a message to hash: ")
hash_value = generate_hash(user_input)
print("Hash Value:", hash_value)

## Student Name: Venkata Vineetha Gandredu
## Student ID: 1230643650
## Date: 1st November 2023

import hashlib 
def generate_hash(message):
    hash_object = hashlib.sha256(message.encode())
    return hash_object.hexdigest()

# User Input
user_input = input("Enter a message to hash: ")
hash_value = generate_hash(user_input)
print("Hash Value:", hash_value)

from Crypto.PublicKey import RSA
from Crypto.Signature import pkcs1_15
from Crypto.Hash import SHA256

# Generate RSA key pair
key = RSA.generate(2048)

# Sender (Alice) signs the message
message = b"Hello Bob, this message is signed by Alice."
hash_message = SHA256.new(message)
signature = pkcs1_15.new(key).sign(hash_message)

# Receiver (Bob) verifies the signature
verifier = pkcs1_15.new(key.publickey())

try:
    verifier.verify(hash_message, signature)
    print("Digital Signature Verified: Message is Authentic.")
except (ValueError, TypeError):
    print("Digital Signature Verification Failed: Message may have been tampered.")
## Student Name: Venkata Vineetha Gandredu
## Student ID: 1230643650
## Date: 1st November 2023

import hashlib 
def generate_hash(message):
    hash_object = hashlib.sha256(message.encode())
    return hash_object.hexdigest()

# User Input

hash_value = generate_hash(user_input)
print("Hash Value:", hash_value)

## Student Name: Venkata Vineetha Gandredu
## Student ID: 1230643650
## Date: 1st November 2023

import hashlib 
def generate_hash(message):
    hash_object = hashlib.sha256(message.encode())
    return hash_object.hexdigest()

# User Input
user_input = input("Enter a message to hash: ")
hash_value = generate_hash(user_input)
print("Hash Value:", hash_value)

from Crypto.PublicKey import RSA
from Crypto.Signature import pkcs1_15
from Crypto.Hash import SHA256

# Generate RSA key pair
key = RSA.generate(2048)

# Sender (Alice) signs the message
message = b"Hello Bob, this message is signed by Alice."
hash_message = SHA256.new(message)
signature = pkcs1_15.new(key).sign(hash_message)

# Receiver (Bob) verifies the signature
verifier = pkcs1_15.new(key.publickey())

try:
    verifier.verify(hash_message, signature)
    print("Digital Signature Verified: Message is Authentic.")
except (ValueError, TypeError):
    print("Digital Signature Verification Failed: Message may have been tampered.")
## Student Name: Venkata Vineetha Gandredu
## Student ID: 1230643650
## Date: 1st November 2023

import hashlib 
def generate_hash(message):
    hash_object = hashlib.sha256(message.encode())

from Crypto.Signature import pkcs1_15
from Crypto.Hash import SHA256

# Generate RSA key pair

# Sender (Alice) signs the message

hash_message = SHA256.new(message)
signature = pkcs1_15.new(key).sign(hash_message)

# Receiver (Bob) verifies the signature

    verifier.verify(hash_message, signature)

except (ValueError, TypeError):
    print("Digital Signature Verification Failed: Message may have been tampered.")

try:
    verifier.verify(hash_message, signature)
    print("Digital Signature Verified: Message is Authentic.")
except (ValueError, TypeError):
    print("Digital Signature Verification Failed: Message may have been tampered.”)*/## Student Name: Venkata Vineetha Gandredu
## Student ID: 1230643650
## Date: 1st November 2023

import hashlib 
def generate_hash(message):
    hash_object = hashlib.sha256(message.encode())
    return hash_object.hexdigest()

# User Input
user_input = input("Enter a message to hash: ")
hash_value = generate_hash(user_input)
print("Hash Value:", hash_value)

from Crypto.PublicKey import RSA
from Crypto.Signature import pkcs1_15
from Crypto.Hash import SHA256

# Generate RSA key pair
key = RSA.generate(2048)

# Sender (Alice) signs the message
message = b"Hello Bob, this message is signed by Alice."
hash_message = SHA256.new(message)
signature = pkcs1_15.new(key).sign(hash_message)

# Receiver (Bob) verifies the signature
verifier = pkcs1_15.new(key.publickey())

try:
    verifier.verify(hash_message, signature)
    print("Digital Signature Verified: Message is Authentic.")
except (ValueError, TypeError):
    print("Digital Signature Verification Failed: Message may have been tampered.")
## Student Name: Venkata Vineetha Gandredu
## Student ID: 1230643650
## Date: 1st November 2023

import hashlib 
def generate_hash(message):
    hash_object = hashlib.sha256(message.encode())
    return hash_object.hexdigest()

# User Input

hash_value = generate_hash(user_input)
print("Hash Value:", hash_value)

from Crypto.PublicKey import RSA
from Crypto.Signature import pkcs1_15
from Crypto.Hash import SHA256

# Generate RSA key pair

# Sender (Alice) signs the message
message = b"Hello Bob, this message is signed by Alice."

signature = pkcs1_15.new(key).sign(hash_message)

try:
    verifier.verify(hash_message, signature)
    print("Digital Signature Verified: Message is Authentic.")
except (ValueError, TypeError):
    print("Digital Signature Verification Failed: Message may have been tampered.")

from Crypto.PublicKey import RSA
from Crypto.Signature import pkcs1_15
from Crypto.Hash import SHA256

# Generate RSA key pair
key = RSA.generate(2048)

# Sender (Alice) signs the message
message = b"Hello Bob, this message is signed by Alice."
hash_message = SHA256.new(message)
signature = pkcs1_15.new(key).sign(hash_message)

# Receiver (Bob) verifies the signature
verifier = pkcs1_15.new(key.publickey())

try:
    verifier.verify(hash_message, signature)
    print("Digital Signature Verified: Message is Authentic.")
except (ValueError, TypeError):
    print("Digital Signature Verification Failed: Message may have been tampered.")

## Student Name: Venkata Vineetha Gandredu
## Student ID: 1230643650
## Date: 1st November 2023

import hashlib 
def generate_hash(message):
    hash_object = hashlib.sha256(message.encode())
    return hash_object.hexdigest()

# User Input
user_input = input("Enter a message to hash: ")
hash_value = generate_hash(user_input)
print("Hash Value:", hash_value)

from Crypto.PublicKey import RSA
from Crypto.Signature import pkcs1_15
from Crypto.Hash import SHA256

# Generate RSA key pair
key = RSA.generate(2048)

# Sender (Alice) signs the message
message = b"Hello Bob, this message is signed by Alice."
hash_message = SHA256.new(message)
signature = pkcs1_15.new(key).sign(hash_message)

# Receiver (Bob) verifies the signature
verifier = pkcs1_15.new(key.publickey())

try:
    verifier.verify(hash_message, signature)
    print("Digital Signature Verified: Message is Authentic.")
except (ValueError, TypeError):
    print("Digital Signature Verification Failed: Message may have been tampered.")

import hashlib 
def generate_hash(message):
    hash_object = hashlib.sha256(message.encode())
    return hash_object.hexdigest()

# User Input

from Crypto.PublicKey import RSA
from Crypto.Signature import pkcs1_15
from Crypto.Hash import SHA256

# Generate RSA key pair
key = RSA.generate(2048)

# Sender (Alice) signs the message
message = b"Hello Bob, this message is signed by Alice."
hash_message = SHA256.new(message)
signature = pkcs1_15.new(key).sign(hash_message)

# Receiver (Bob) verifies the signature
verifier = pkcs1_15.new(key.publickey())

try:
    verifier.verify(hash_message, signature)
    print("Digital Signature Verified: Message is Authentic.")
except (ValueError, TypeError):
    print("Digital Signature Verification Failed: Message may have been tampered.")
## Student Name: Venkata Vineetha Gandredu
## Student ID: 1230643650
## Date: 1st November 2023

import hashlib 
def generate_hash(message):
    hash_object = hashlib.sha256(message.encode())
    return hash_object.hexdigest()

# User Input
user_input = input("Enter a message to hash: ")
hash_value = generate_hash(user_input)
print("Hash Value:", hash_value)

from Crypto.Signature import pkcs1_15
from Crypto.Hash import SHA256

try:
    verifier.verify(hash_message, signature)
    print("Digital Signature Verified: Message is Authentic.")
except (ValueError, TypeError):
    print("Digital Signature Verification Failed: Message may have been tampered.")

## Student Name: Venkata Vineetha Gandredu
## Student ID: 1230643650
## Date: 1st November 2023

import hashlib 
def generate_hash(message):
    hash_object = hashlib.sha256(message.encode())
    return hash_object.hexdigest()

# User Input
user_input = input("Enter a message to hash: ")
hash_value = generate_hash(user_input)
print("Hash Value:", hash_value)

from Crypto.PublicKey import RSA
from Crypto.Signature import pkcs1_15
from Crypto.Hash import SHA256

# Generate RSA key pair
key = RSA.generate(2048)

# Sender (Alice) signs the message
message = b"Hello Bob, this message is signed by Alice."
hash_message = SHA256.new(message)
signature = pkcs1_15.new(key).sign(hash_message)

# Receiver (Bob) verifies the signature
verifier = pkcs1_15.new(key.publickey())

try:
    verifier.verify(hash_message, signature)
    print("Digital Signature Verified: Message is Authentic.")
except (ValueError, TypeError):
    print("Digital Signature Verification Failed: Message may have been tampered.")
## Student Name: Venkata Vineetha Gandredu
## Student ID: 1230643650
## Date: 1st November 2023

import hashlib 
def generate_hash(message):
    hash_object = hashlib.sha256(message.encode())
    return hash_object.hexdigest()

# User Input
user_input = input("Enter a message to hash: ")
hash_value = generate_hash(user_input)
print("Hash Value:", hash_value)

## Date: 1st November 2023

import hashlib 
def generate_hash(message):
    hash_object = hashlib.sha256(message.encode())
    return hash_object.hexdigest()

# User Input
user_input = input("Enter a message to hash: ")
hash_value = generate_hash(user_input)
print("Hash Value:", hash_value)

from Crypto.PublicKey import RSA
from Crypto.Signature import pkcs1_15
from Crypto.Hash import SHA256

# Generate RSA key pair
key = RSA.generate(2048)

# Sender (Alice) signs the message
message = b"Hello Bob, this message is signed by Alice."
hash_message = SHA256.new(message)
signature = pkcs1_15.new(key).sign(hash_message)

# Receiver (Bob) verifies the signature
verifier = pkcs1_15.new(key.publickey())

try:
    verifier.verify(hash_message, signature)
    print("Digital Signature Verified: Message is Authentic.")
except (ValueError, TypeError):
    print("Digital Signature Verification Failed: Message may have been tampered.")
## Student Name: Venkata Vineetha Gandredu
## Student ID: 1230643650
## Date: 1st November 2023

# User Input

print("Hash Value:", hash_value)

import hashlib 
def generate_hash(message):
    hash_object = hashlib.sha256(message.encode())
    return hash_object.hexdigest()

from Crypto.PublicKey import RSA
from Crypto.Signature import pkcs1_15
from Crypto.Hash import SHA256

# Generate RSA key pair
key = RSA.generate(2048)

# Sender (Alice) signs the message
message = b"Hello Bob, this message is signed by Alice."
hash_message = SHA256.new(message)
signature = pkcs1_15.new(key).sign(hash_message)

# Receiver (Bob) verifies the signature
verifier = pkcs1_15.new(key.publickey())

try:
    verifier.verify(hash_message, signature)
    print("Digital Signature Verified: Message is Authentic.")
except (ValueError, TypeError):
    print("Digital Signature Verification Failed: Message may have been tampered.")

## Student Name: Venkata Vineetha Gandredu
## Student ID: 1230643650
## Date: 1st November 2023

import hashlib 
def generate_hash(message):
    hash_object = hashlib.sha256(message.encode())
    return hash_object.hexdigest()

# User Input
user_input = input("Enter a message to hash: ")
hash_value = generate_hash(user_input)
print("Hash Value:", hash_value)

from Crypto.PublicKey import RSA
from Crypto.Signature import pkcs1_15
from Crypto.Hash import SHA256

# Generate RSA key pair
key = RSA.generate(2048)

# Sender (Alice) signs the message
message = b"Hello Bob, this message is signed by Alice."
hash_message = SHA256.new(message)
signature = pkcs1_15.new(key).sign(hash_message)

# Receiver (Bob) verifies the signature
verifier = pkcs1_15.new(key.publickey())

try:
    verifier.verify(hash_message, signature)
    print("Digital Signature Verified: Message is Authentic.")
except (ValueError, TypeError):
    print("Digital Signature Verification Failed: Message may have been tampered.")

## Student Name: Venkata Vineetha Gandredu

import hashlib 
def generate_hash(message):
    hash_object = hashlib.sha256(message.encode())
    return hash_object.hexdigest()

# User Input
user_input = input("Enter a message to hash: ")
hash_value = generate_hash(user_input)
print("Hash Value:", hash_value)

from Crypto.PublicKey import RSA
from Crypto.Signature import pkcs1_15
from Crypto.Hash import SHA256

# Generate RSA key pair
key = RSA.generate(2048)

# Sender (Alice) signs the message
message = b"Hello Bob, this message is signed by Alice."
hash_message = SHA256.new(message)
signature = pkcs1_15.new(key).sign(hash_message)

# Receiver (Bob) verifies the signature
verifier = pkcs1_15.new(key.publickey())

try:
    verifier.verify(hash_message, signature)
    print("Digital Signature Verified: Message is Authentic.")
except (ValueError, TypeError):
    print("Digital Signature Verification Failed: Message may have been tampered.")
## Student Name: Venkata Vineetha Gandredu
## Student ID: 1230643650
## Date: 1st November 2023

import hashlib 
def generate_hash(message):
    hash_object = hashlib.sha256(message.encode())
    return hash_object.hexdigest()

# User Input
user_input = input("Enter a message to hash: ")
hash_value = generate_hash(user_input)
print("Hash Value:", hash_value)

from Crypto.PublicKey import RSA
from Crypto.Signature import pkcs1_15
from Crypto.Hash import SHA256

# Generate RSA key pair
key = RSA.generate(2048)

# Sender (Alice) signs the message
message = b"Hello Bob, this message is signed by Alice."
hash_message = SHA256.new(message)
signature = pkcs1_15.new(key).sign(hash_message)

# Receiver (Bob) verifies the signature
verifier = pkcs1_15.new(key.publickey())

try:
    verifier.verify(hash_message, signature)
    print("Digital Signature Verified: Message is Authentic.")
except (ValueError, TypeError):
    print("Digital Signature Verification Failed: Message may have been tampered.")

print("Hash Value:", hash_value)

from Crypto.PublicKey import RSA
from Crypto.Signature import pkcs1_15
from Crypto.Hash import SHA256

# Generate RSA key pair
key = RSA.generate(2048)

# Sender (Alice) signs the message
message = b"Hello Bob, this message is signed by Alice."
hash_message = SHA256.new(message)
signature = pkcs1_15.new(key).sign(hash_message)

# Receiver (Bob) verifies the signature
verifier = pkcs1_15.new(key.publickey())

try:
    verifier.verify(hash_message, signature)
    print("Digital Signature Verified: Message is Authentic.")
except (ValueError, TypeError):
    print("Digital Signature Verification Failed: Message may have been tampered.")
## Student Name: Venkata Vineetha Gandredu
## Student ID: 1230643650
## Date: 1st November 2023

import hashlib 
def generate_hash(message):
    hash_object = hashlib.sha256(message.encode())
    return hash_object.hexdigest()

# User Input
user_input = input("Enter a message to hash: ")
hash_value = generate_hash(user_input)
print("Hash Value:", hash_value)

from Crypto.PublicKey import RSA
from Crypto.Signature import pkcs1_15
from Crypto.Hash import SHA256

# Generate RSA key pair

# Sender (Alice) signs the message

try:
    verifier.verify(hash_message, signature)
    print("Digital Signature Verified: Message is Authentic.")
except (ValueError, TypeError):
    print("Digital Signature Verification Failed: Message may have been tampered.")

def generate_hash(message):
    hash_object = hashlib.sha256(message.encode())
    return hash_object.hexdigest()

# User Input
user_input = input("Enter a message to hash: ")
hash_value = generate_hash(user_input)
print("Hash Value:", hash_value)

from Crypto.PublicKey import RSA
from Crypto.Signature import pkcs1_15
from Crypto.Hash import SHA256

# Generate RSA key pair
key = RSA.generate(2048)

# Sender (Alice) signs the message
message = b"Hello Bob, this message is signed by Alice."
hash_message = SHA256.new(message)
signature = pkcs1_15.new(key).sign(hash_message)

# Receiver (Bob) verifies the signature
verifier = pkcs1_15.new(key.publickey())

try:
    verifier.verify(hash_message, signature)
    print("Digital Signature Verified: Message is Authentic.")
except (ValueError, TypeError):
    print("Digital Signature Verification Failed: Message may have been tampered.")
## Student Name: Venkata Vineetha Gandredu
## Student ID: 1230643650
## Date: 1st November 2023

import hashlib

import hashlib 
def generate_hash(message):
    hash_object = hashlib.sha256(message.encode())
    return hash_object.hexdigest()

# User Input

from Crypto.PublicKey import RSA
from Crypto.Signature import pkcs1_15
from Crypto.Hash import SHA256

# Generate RSA key pair
key = RSA.generate(2048)

# Sender (Alice) signs the message
message = b"Hello Bob, this message is signed by Alice."
hash_message = SHA256.new(message)
signature = pkcs1_15.new(key).sign(hash_message)

# Receiver (Bob) verifies the signature
verifier = pkcs1_15.new(key.publickey())

try:
    verifier.verify(hash_message, signature)
    print("Digital Signature Verified: Message is Authentic.")
except (ValueError, TypeError):
    print("Digital Signature Verification Failed: Message may have been tampered.")

## Student Name: Venkata Vineetha Gandredu
## Student ID: 1230643650
## Date: 1st November 2023

import hashlib 
def generate_hash(message):
    hash_object = hashlib.sha256(message.encode())
    return hash_object.hexdigest()

# User Input
user_input = input("Enter a message to hash: ")
hash_value = generate_hash(user_input)
print("Hash Value:", hash_value)

from Crypto.PublicKey import RSA
from Crypto.Signature import pkcs1_15
from Crypto.Hash import SHA256

# Generate RSA key pair
key = RSA.generate(2048)

# Sender (Alice) signs the message
message = b"Hello Bob, this message is signed by Alice."
hash_message = SHA256.new(message)
signature = pkcs1_15.new(key).sign(hash_message)

# Receiver (Bob) verifies the signature
verifier = pkcs1_15.new(key.publickey())

try:
    verifier.verify(hash_message, signature)
    print("Digital Signature Verified: Message is Authentic.")
except (ValueError, TypeError):
    print("Digital Signature Verification Failed: Message may have been tampered.")

from Crypto.PublicKey import RSA
from Crypto.Signature import pkcs1_15
from Crypto.Hash import SHA256

# Generate RSA key pair
key = RSA.generate(2048)

# Sender (Alice) signs the message
message = b"Hello Bob, this message is signed by Alice."
hash_message = SHA256.new(message)
signature = pkcs1_15.new(key).sign(hash_message)

# Receiver (Bob) verifies the signature
verifier = pkcs1_15.new(key.publickey())

try:
    verifier.verify(hash_message, signature)
    print("Digital Signature Verified: Message is Authentic.")
except (ValueError, TypeError):
    print("Digital Signature Verification Failed: Message may have been tampered.")
## Student Name: Venkata Vineetha Gandredu
## Student ID: 1230643650
## Date: 1st November 2023

import hashlib 
def generate_hash(message):
    hash_object = hashlib.sha256(message.encode())
    return hash_object.hexdigest()

# User Input
user_input = input("Enter a message to hash: ")
hash_value = generate_hash(user_input)
print("Hash Value:", hash_value)

from Crypto.PublicKey import RSA
from Crypto.Signature import pkcs1_15
from Crypto.Hash import SHA256

# Generate RSA key pair
key = RSA.generate(2048)

# Sender (Alice) signs the message
message = b"Hello Bob, this message is signed by Alice."
hash_message = SHA256.new(message)
signature = pkcs1_15.new(key).sign(hash_message)

# Receiver (Bob) verifies the signature
verifier = pkcs1_15.new(key.publickey())

try:
    verifier.verify(hash_message, signature)
    print("Digital Signature Verified: Message is Authentic.")
except (ValueError, TypeError):
    print("Digital Signature Verification Failed: Message may have been tampered.")

import hashlib 
def generate_hash(message):
    hash_object = hashlib.sha256(message.encode())
    return hash_object.hexdigest()

# User Input
user_input = input("Enter a message to hash: ")

from Crypto.PublicKey import RSA
from Crypto.Signature import pkcs1_15
from Crypto.Hash import SHA256

# Generate RSA key pair
key = RSA.generate(2048)

# Sender (Alice) signs the message
message = b"Hello Bob, this message is signed by Alice."
hash_message = SHA256.new(message)
signature = pkcs1_15.new(key).sign(hash_message)

# Receiver (Bob) verifies the signature
verifier = pkcs1_15.new(key.publickey())

try:
    verifier.verify(hash_message, signature)
    print("Digital Signature Verified: Message is Authentic.")
except (ValueError, TypeError):
    print("Digital Signature Verification Failed: Message may have been tampered.")
## Student Name: Venkata Vineetha Gandredu
## Student ID: 1230643650
## Date: 1st November 2023

import hashlib 
def generate_hash(message):
    hash_object = hashlib.sha256(message.encode())
    return hash_object.hexdigest()

# User Input
user_input = input("Enter a message to hash: ")
hash_value = generate_hash(user_input)
print("Hash Value:", hash_value)

from Crypto.PublicKey import RSA
from Crypto.Signature import pkcs1_15
from Crypto.Hash import SHA256

# Generate RSA key pair
key = RSA.generate(2048)

# Sender (Alice) signs the message
message = b"Hello Bob, this message is signed by Alice."
hash_message = SHA256.new(message)
signature = pkcs1_15.new(key).sign(hash_message)

# Receiver (Bob) verifies the signature
verifier = pkcs1_15.new(key.publickey())

try:
    verifier.verify(hash_message, signature)
    print("Digital Signature Verified: Message is Authentic.")
except (ValueError, TypeError):
    print("Digital Signature Verification Failed: Message may have been tampered.")

user_input = input("Enter a message to hash: ")
hash_value = generate_hash(user_input)
print("Hash Value:", hash_value)

from Crypto.PublicKey import RSA
from Crypto.Signature import pkcs1_15
from Crypto.Hash import SHA256

# Generate RSA key pair
key = RSA.generate(2048)

# Sender (Alice) signs the message
message = b"Hello Bob, this message is signed by Alice."
hash_message = SHA256.new(message)
signature = pkcs1_15.new(key).sign(hash_message)

# Receiver (Bob) verifies the signature
verifier = pkcs1_15.new(key.publickey())

try:
    verifier.verify(hash_message, signature)
    print("Digital Signature Verified: Message is Authentic.")
except (ValueError, TypeError):
    print("Digital Signature Verification Failed: Message may have been tampered.")
## Student Name: Venkata Vineetha Gandredu
## Student ID: 1230643650
## Date: 1st November 2023

import hashlib 
def generate_hash(message):
    hash_object = hashlib.sha256(message.encode())
    return hash_object.hexdigest()

# User Input
user_input = input("Enter a message to hash: ")
hash_value = generate_hash(user_input)
print("Hash Value:", hash_value)

from Crypto.PublicKey import RSA
from Crypto.Signature import pkcs1_15
from Crypto.Hash import SHA256

# Generate RSA key pair

# Sender (Alice) signs the message

try:
    verifier.verify(hash_message, signature)
    print("Digital Signature Verified: Message is Authentic.")
except (ValueError, TypeError):
    print("Digital Signature Verification Failed: Message may have been tampered.")

from Crypto.Hash import SHA256

## Student Name: Venkata Vineetha Gandredu

## Date: 1st November 2023

import hashlib 
def generate_hash(message):
    hash_object = hashlib.sha256(message.encode())
    return hash_object.hexdigest()

# User Input
user_input = input("Enter a message to hash: ")
hash_value = generate_hash(user_input)
print("Hash Value:", hash_value)

from Crypto.PublicKey import RSA
from Crypto.Signature import pkcs1_15
from Crypto.Hash import SHA256

# Generate RSA key pair
key = RSA.generate(2048)

# Sender (Alice) signs the message
message = b"Hello Bob, this message is signed by Alice."
hash_message = SHA256.new(message)
signature = pkcs1_15.new(key).sign(hash_message)

# Receiver (Bob) verifies the signature
verifier = pkcs1_15.new(key.publickey())

try:
    verifier.verify(hash_message, signature)
    print("Digital Signature Verified: Message is Authentic.")
except (ValueError, TypeError):
    print("Digital Signature Verification Failed: Message may have been tampered.")

from Crypto.PublicKey import RSA
from Crypto.Signature import pkcs1_15
from Crypto.Hash import SHA256

# Generate RSA key pair
key = RSA.generate(2048)

# Sender (Alice) signs the message
message = b"Hello Bob, this message is signed by Alice."
hash_message = SHA256.new(message)
signature = pkcs1_15.new(key).sign(hash_message)

# Receiver (Bob) verifies the signature
verifier = pkcs1_15.new(key.publickey())

try:
    verifier.verify(hash_message, signature)
    print("Digital Signature Verified: Message is Authentic.")
except (ValueError, TypeError):
    print("Digital Signature Verification Failed: Message may have been tampered.")
## Student Name: Venkata Vineetha Gandredu
## Student ID: 1230643650
## Date: 1st November 2023

import hashlib 
def generate_hash(message):
    hash_object = hashlib.sha256(message.encode())
    return hash_object.hexdigest()

# User Input
user_input = input("Enter a message to hash: ")
hash_value = generate_hash(user_input)
print("Hash Value:", hash_value)

from Crypto.PublicKey import RSA
from Crypto.Signature import pkcs1_15
from Crypto.Hash import SHA256

# Generate RSA key pair
key = RSA.generate(2048)

# Sender (Alice) signs the message
message = b"Hello Bob, this message is signed by Alice."
hash_message = SHA256.new(message)
signature = pkcs1_15.new(key).sign(hash_message)

# Receiver (Bob) verifies the signature
verifier = pkcs1_15.new(key.publickey())

try:
    verifier.verify(hash_message, signature)
    print("Digital Signature Verified: Message is Authentic.")
except (ValueError, TypeError):
    print("Digital Signature Verification Failed: Message may have been tampered.")
## Student Name: Venkata Vineetha Gandredu
## Student ID: 1230643650
## Date: 1st November 2023

import hashlib 
def generate_hash(message):
    hash_object = hashlib.sha256(message.encode())

# User Input

from Crypto.PublicKey import RSA
from Crypto.Signature import pkcs1_15
from Crypto.Hash import SHA256

# Generate RSA key pair
key = RSA.generate(2048)

# Sender (Alice) signs the message
message = b"Hello Bob, this message is signed by Alice."
hash_message = SHA256.new(message)
signature = pkcs1_15.new(key).sign(hash_message)

# Receiver (Bob) verifies the signature
verifier = pkcs1_15.new(key.publickey())

try:
    verifier.verify(hash_message, signature)
    print("Digital Signature Verified: Message is Authentic.")
except (ValueError, TypeError):
    print("Digital Signature Verification Failed: Message may have been tampered.")
## Student Name: Venkata Vineetha Gandredu
## Student ID: 1230643650
## Date: 1st November 2023

import hashlib 
def generate_hash(message):
    hash_object = hashlib.sha256(message.encode())
    return hash_object.hexdigest()

# User Input
user_input = input("Enter a message to hash: ")
hash_value = generate_hash(user_input)
print("Hash Value:", hash_value)

from Crypto.PublicKey import RSA
from Crypto.Signature import pkcs1_15
from Crypto.Hash import SHA256

# Generate RSA key pair
key = RSA.generate(2048)

# Sender (Alice) signs the message
message = b"Hello Bob, this message is signed by Alice."
hash_message = SHA256.new(message)
signature = pkcs1_15.new(key).sign(hash_message)

# Receiver (Bob) verifies the signature
verifier = pkcs1_15.new(key.publickey())

try:
    verifier.verify(hash_message, signature)
    print("Digital Signature Verified: Message is Authentic.")
except (ValueError, TypeError):
    print("Digital Signature Verification Failed: Message may have been tampered.")

from Crypto.PublicKey import RSA
from Crypto.Signature import pkcs1_15
from Crypto.Hash import SHA256

# Generate RSA key pair
key = RSA.generate(2048)

# Sender (Alice) signs the message
message = b"Hello Bob, this message is signed by Alice."
hash_message = SHA256.new(message)
signature = pkcs1_15.new(key).sign(hash_message)

# Receiver (Bob) verifies the signature
verifier = pkcs1_15.new(key.publickey())

try:
    verifier.verify(hash_message, signature)
    print("Digital Signature Verified: Message is Authentic.")
except (ValueError, TypeError):
    print("Digital Signature Verification Failed: Message may have been tampered.")
## Student Name: Venkata Vineetha Gandredu
## Student ID: 1230643650
## Date: 1st November 2023

import hashlib 
def generate_hash(message):
    hash_object = hashlib.sha256(message.encode())
    return hash_object.hexdigest()

# User Input
user_input = input("Enter a message to hash: ")
hash_value = generate_hash(user_input)
print("Hash Value:", hash_value)

from Crypto.PublicKey import RSA
from Crypto.Signature import pkcs1_15
from Crypto.Hash import SHA256

# Generate RSA key pair
key = RSA.generate(2048)

# Sender (Alice) signs the message
message = b"Hello Bob, this message is signed by Alice."
hash_message = SHA256.new(message)
signature = pkcs1_15.new(key).sign(hash_message)

# Receiver (Bob) verifies the signature
verifier = pkcs1_15.new(key.publickey())

try:
    verifier.verify(hash_message, signature)
    print("Digital Signature Verified: Message is Authentic.")
except (ValueError, TypeError):
    print("Digital Signature Verification Failed: Message may have been tampered.")

## Student Name: Venkata Vineetha Gandredu
## Student ID: 1230643650
## Date: 1st November 2023

import hashlib 
def generate_hash(message):
    hash_object = hashlib.sha256(message.encode())
    return hash_object.hexdigest()

# User Input
user_input = input("Enter a message to hash: ")
hash_value = generate_hash(user_input)
print("Hash Value:", hash_value)

from Crypto.PublicKey import RSA
from Crypto.Signature import pkcs1_15
from Crypto.Hash import SHA256

# Generate RSA key pair
key = RSA.generate(2048)

# Sender (Alice) signs the message
message = b"Hello Bob, this message is signed by Alice."
hash_message = SHA256.new(message)
signature = pkcs1_15.new(key).sign(hash_message)

# Receiver (Bob) verifies the signature
verifier = pkcs1_15.new(key.publickey())

try:
    verifier.verify(hash_message, signature)
    print("Digital Signature Verified: Message is Authentic.")
except (ValueError, TypeError):
    print("Digital Signature Verification Failed: Message may have been tampered.")



## Student Name: Venkata Vineetha Gandredu
## Student ID: 1230643650
## Date: 1st November 2023

import hashlib 
def generate_hash(message):
    hash_object = hashlib.sha256(message.encode())
    return hash_object.hexdigest()

from Crypto.Signature import pkcs1_15
from Crypto.Hash import SHA256

# Generate RSA key pair
key = RSA.generate(2048)

# Sender (Alice) signs the message
message = b"Hello Bob, this message is signed by Alice."

    verifier.verify(hash_message, signature)
    print("Digital Signature Verified: Message is Authentic.")
except (ValueError, TypeError):
    print("Digital Signature Verification Failed: Message may have been tampered.")

## Student ID: 1230643650
## Date: 1st November 2023

import hashlib 
def generate_hash(message):
    hash_object = hashlib.sha256(message.encode())
    return hash_object.hexdigest()

# User Input
user_input = input("Enter a message to hash: ")
hash_value = generate_hash(user_input)
print("Hash Value:", hash_value)

from Crypto.PublicKey import RSA
from Crypto.Signature import pkcs1_15
from Crypto.Hash import SHA256

# Generate RSA key pair
key = RSA.generate(2048)

# Sender (Alice) signs the message
message = b"Hello Bob, this message is signed by Alice."
hash_message = SHA256.new(message)
signature = pkcs1_15.new(key).sign(hash_message)

# Receiver (Bob) verifies the signature
verifier = pkcs1_15.new(key.publickey())

try:
    verifier.verify(hash_message, signature)
    print("Digital Signature Verified: Message is Authentic.")
except (ValueError, TypeError):
    print("Digital Signature Verification Failed: Message may have been tampered.")
## Student Name: Venkata Vineetha Gandredu
## Student ID: 1230643650
## Date: 1st November 2023

from Crypto.PublicKey import RSA
from Crypto.Signature import pkcs1_15
from Crypto.Hash import SHA256

# Generate RSA key pair
key = RSA.generate(2048)

# Sender (Alice) signs the message
message = b"Hello Bob, this message is signed by Alice."
hash_message = SHA256.new(message)
signature = pkcs1_15.new(key).sign(hash_message)

# Receiver (Bob) verifies the signature
verifier = pkcs1_15.new(key.publickey())

try:
    verifier.verify(hash_message, signature)
    print("Digital Signature Verified: Message is Authentic.")
except (ValueError, TypeError):
    print("Digital Signature Verification Failed: Message may have been tampered.")
## Student Name: Venkata Vineetha Gandredu
## Student ID: 1230643650
## Date: 1st November 2023

import hashlib 
def generate_hash(message):
    hash_object = hashlib.sha256(message.encode())
    return hash_object.hexdigest()

# User Input
user_input = input("Enter a message to hash: ")
hash_value = generate_hash(user_input)
print("Hash Value:", hash_value)

from Crypto.PublicKey import RSA
from Crypto.Signature import pkcs1_15
from Crypto.Hash import SHA256

# Generate RSA key pair
key = RSA.generate(2048)

# Sender (Alice) signs the message
message = b"Hello Bob, this message is signed by Alice."
hash_message = SHA256.new(message)
signature = pkcs1_15.new(key).sign(hash_message)

# Receiver (Bob) verifies the signature
verifier = pkcs1_15.new(key.publickey())

try:
    verifier.verify(hash_message, signature)
    print("Digital Signature Verified: Message is Authentic.")
except (ValueError, TypeError):
    print("Digital Signature Verification Failed: Message may have been tampered.")

from Crypto.Signature import pkcs1_15
from Crypto.Hash import SHA256

# Generate RSA key pair
key = RSA.generate(2048)

# Sender (Alice) signs the message
message = b"Hello Bob, this message is signed by Alice."
hash_message = SHA256.new(message)
signature = pkcs1_15.new(key).sign(hash_message)

# Receiver (Bob) verifies the signature
verifier = pkcs1_15.new(key.publickey())

try:
    verifier.verify(hash_message, signature)
    print("Digital Signature Verified: Message is Authentic.")
except (ValueError, TypeError):
    print("Digital Signature Verification Failed: Message may have been tampered.")
## Student Name: Venkata Vineetha Gandredu
## Student ID: 1230643650
## Date: 1st November 2023

import hashlib 
def generate_hash(message):
    hash_object = hashlib.sha256(message.encode())
    return hash_object.hexdigest()

# User Input
user_input = input("Enter a message to hash: ")
hash_value = generate_hash(user_input)
print("Hash Value:", hash_value)

from Crypto.PublicKey import RSA
from Crypto.Signature import pkcs1_15
from Crypto.Hash import SHA256

# Generate RSA key pair
key = RSA.generate(2048)

# Sender (Alice) signs the message
message = b"Hello Bob, this message is signed by Alice."
hash_message = SHA256.new(message)
signature = pkcs1_15.new(key).sign(hash_message)

# Receiver (Bob) verifies the signature
verifier = pkcs1_15.new(key.publickey())

try:
    verifier.verify(hash_message, signature)
    print("Digital Signature Verified: Message is Authentic.")
except (ValueError, TypeError):
    print("Digital Signature Verification Failed: Message may have been tampered.")

import hashlib 
def generate_hash(message):
    hash_object = hashlib.sha256(message.encode())
    return hash_object.hexdigest()

from Crypto.PublicKey import RSA
from Crypto.Signature import pkcs1_15
from Crypto.Hash import SHA256

# Generate RSA key pair
key = RSA.generate(2048)

# Sender (Alice) signs the message
message = b"Hello Bob, this message is signed by Alice."
hash_message = SHA256.new(message)
signature = pkcs1_15.new(key).sign(hash_message)

# Receiver (Bob) verifies the signature
verifier = pkcs1_15.new(key.publickey())

try:
    verifier.verify(hash_message, signature)
    print("Digital Signature Verified: Message is Authentic.")
except (ValueError, TypeError):
    print("Digital Signature Verification Failed: Message may have been tampered.")


## Student Name: Venkata Vineetha Gandredu
## Student ID: 1230643650
## Date: 1st November 2023

import hashlib 
def generate_hash(message):
    hash_object = hashlib.sha256(message.encode())
    return hash_object.hexdigest()

user_input = input("Enter a message to hash: ")
hash_value = generate_hash(user_input)
print("Hash Value:", hash_value)

from Crypto.Signature import pkcs1_15
from Crypto.Hash import SHA256

# Generate RSA key pair
key = RSA.generate(2048)

# Sender (Alice) signs the message
message = b"Hello Bob, this message is signed by Alice."

## Student Name: Venkata Vineetha Gandredu
## Student ID: 1230643650
## Date: 1st November 2023

import hashlib 
def generate_hash(message):
    hash_object = hashlib.sha256(message.encode())
    return hash_object.hexdigest()

# User Input
user_input = input("Enter a message to hash: ")
hash_value = generate_hash(user_input)
print("Hash Value:", hash_value)

from Crypto.PublicKey import RSA
from Crypto.Signature import pkcs1_15
from Crypto.Hash import SHA256

# Generate RSA key pair
key = RSA.generate(2048)

# Sender (Alice) signs the message
message = b"Hello Bob, this message is signed by Alice."
hash_message = SHA256.new(message)
signature = pkcs1_15.new(key).sign(hash_message)

# Receiver (Bob) verifies the signature
verifier = pkcs1_15.new(key.publickey())

try:
    verifier.verify(hash_message, signature)
    print("Digital Signature Verified: Message is Authentic.")
except (ValueError, TypeError):
    print("Digital Signature Verification Failed: Message may have been tampered.")
## Student Name: Venkata Vineetha Gandredu
## Student ID: 1230643650
## Date: 1st November 2023

import hashlib 
def generate_hash(message):
    hash_object = hashlib.sha256(message.encode())
    return hash_object.hexdigest()

# User Input

hash_value = generate_hash(user_input)
print("Hash Value:", hash_value)

## Student Name: Venkata Vineetha Gandredu
## Student ID: 1230643650
## Date: 1st November 2023

import hashlib 
def generate_hash(message):
    hash_object = hashlib.sha256(message.encode())
    return hash_object.hexdigest()

# User Input
user_input = input("Enter a message to hash: ")
hash_value = generate_hash(user_input)
print("Hash Value:", hash_value)

from Crypto.PublicKey import RSA
from Crypto.Signature import pkcs1_15
from Crypto.Hash import SHA256

# Generate RSA key pair
key = RSA.generate(2048)

# Sender (Alice) signs the message
message = b"Hello Bob, this message is signed by Alice."
hash_message = SHA256.new(message)
signature = pkcs1_15.new(key).sign(hash_message)

# Receiver (Bob) verifies the signature
verifier = pkcs1_15.new(key.publickey())

try:
    verifier.verify(hash_message, signature)
    print("Digital Signature Verified: Message is Authentic.")
except (ValueError, TypeError):
    print("Digital Signature Verification Failed: Message may have been tampered.")



## Student Name: Venkata Vineetha Gandredu

from Crypto.PublicKey import RSA
from Crypto.Signature import pkcs1_15
from Crypto.Hash import SHA256

# Generate RSA key pair
key = RSA.generate(2048)

# Sender (Alice) signs the message
message = b"Hello Bob, this message is signed by Alice."
hash_message = SHA256.new(message)
signature = pkcs1_15.new(key).sign(hash_message)

# Receiver (Bob) verifies the signature
verifier = pkcs1_15.new(key.publickey())

try:
    verifier.verify(hash_message, signature)
    print("Digital Signature Verified: Message is Authentic.")
except (ValueError, TypeError):
    print("Digital Signature Verification Failed: Message may have been tampered.")
## Student Name: Venkata Vineetha Gandredu
## Student ID: 1230643650
## Date: 1st November 2023

import hashlib 
def generate_hash(message):
    hash_object = hashlib.sha256(message.encode())
    return hash_object.hexdigest()

# User Input
user_input = input("Enter a message to hash: ")
hash_value = generate_hash(user_input)
print("Hash Value:", hash_value)

from Crypto.PublicKey import RSA
from Crypto.Signature import pkcs1_15
from Crypto.Hash import SHA256

# Generate RSA key pair
key = RSA.generate(2048)

# Sender (Alice) signs the message
message = b"Hello Bob, this message is signed by Alice."
hash_message = SHA256.new(message)
signature = pkcs1_15.new(key).sign(hash_message)

# Receiver (Bob) verifies the signature
verifier = pkcs1_15.new(key.publickey())

try:
    verifier.verify(hash_message, signature)
    print("Digital Signature Verified: Message is Authentic.")
except (ValueError, TypeError):
    print("Digital Signature Verification Failed: Message may have been tampered.")

## Student ID: 1230643650

from Crypto.PublicKey import RSA
from Crypto.Signature import pkcs1_15
from Crypto.Hash import SHA256

# Generate RSA key pair
key = RSA.generate(2048)

# Sender (Alice) signs the message
message = b"Hello Bob, this message is signed by Alice."
hash_message = SHA256.new(message)
signature = pkcs1_15.new(key).sign(hash_message)

# Receiver (Bob) verifies the signature
verifier = pkcs1_15.new(key.publickey())

try:
    verifier.verify(hash_message, signature)
    print("Digital Signature Verified: Message is Authentic.")
except (ValueError, TypeError):
    print("Digital Signature Verification Failed: Message may have been tampered.")
## Student Name: Venkata Vineetha Gandredu
## Student ID: 1230643650
## Date: 1st November 2023

import hashlib 
def generate_hash(message):
    hash_object = hashlib.sha256(message.encode())
    return hash_object.hexdigest()

import hashlib 
def generate_hash(message):
    hash_object = hashlib.sha256(message.encode())
    return hash_object.hexdigest()

# User Input

from Crypto.PublicKey import RSA
from Crypto.Signature import pkcs1_15
from Crypto.Hash import SHA256

# Generate RSA key pair
key = RSA.generate(2048)

# Sender (Alice) signs the message
message = b"Hello Bob, this message is signed by Alice."
hash_message = SHA256.new(message)
signature = pkcs1_15.new(key).sign(hash_message)

# Receiver (Bob) verifies the signature
verifier = pkcs1_15.new(key.publickey())

try:
    verifier.verify(hash_message, signature)
    print("Digital Signature Verified: Message is Authentic.")
except (ValueError, TypeError):
    print("Digital Signature Verification Failed: Message may have been tampered.")
## Student Name: Venkata Vineetha Gandredu
## Student ID: 1230643650
## Date: 1st November 2023

import hashlib 
def generate_hash(message):
    hash_object = hashlib.sha256(message.encode())
    return hash_object.hexdigest()

# User Input
user_input = input("Enter a message to hash: ")
hash_value = generate_hash(user_input)
print("Hash Value:", hash_value)

from Crypto.Signature import pkcs1_15
from Crypto.Hash import SHA256

except (ValueError, TypeError):
    print("Digital Signature Verification Failed: Message may have been tampered.")

## Student Name: Venkata Vineetha Gandredu
## Student ID: 1230643650
## Date: 1st November 2023

import hashlib 
def generate_hash(message):
    hash_object = hashlib.sha256(message.encode())
    return hash_object.hexdigest()

# User Input
user_input = input("Enter a message to hash: ")
hash_value = generate_hash(user_input)
print("Hash Value:", hash_value)

from Crypto.PublicKey import RSA
from Crypto.Signature import pkcs1_15
from Crypto.Hash import SHA256

# Generate RSA key pair
key = RSA.generate(2048)

# Sender (Alice) signs the message
message = b"Hello Bob, this message is signed by Alice."
hash_message = SHA256.new(message)
signature = pkcs1_15.new(key).sign(hash_message)

# Receiver (Bob) verifies the signature
verifier = pkcs1_15.new(key.publickey())

try:
    verifier.verify(hash_message, signature)
    print("Digital Signature Verified: Message is Authentic.")
except (ValueError, TypeError):
    print("Digital Signature Verification Failed: Message may have been tampered.")



## Student Name: Venkata Vineetha Gandredu
## Student ID: 1230643650
## Date: 1st November 2023

import hashlib 
def generate_hash(message):
    hash_object = hashlib.sha256(message.encode())
    return hash_object.hexdigest()

# User Input

hash_value = generate_hash(user_input)
print("Hash Value:", hash_value)

## Student Name: Venkata Vineetha Gandredu
## Student ID: 1230643650
## Date: 1st November 2023

import hashlib 
def generate_hash(message):
    hash_object = hashlib.sha256(message.encode())
    return hash_object.hexdigest()

# User Input
user_input = input("Enter a message to hash: ")
hash_value = generate_hash(user_input)
print("Hash Value:", hash_value)

from Crypto.PublicKey import RSA
from Crypto.Signature import pkcs1_15
from Crypto.Hash import SHA256

# Generate RSA key pair
key = RSA.generate(2048)

# Sender (Alice) signs the message
message = b"Hello Bob, this message is signed by Alice."
hash_message = SHA256.new(message)
signature = pkcs1_15.new(key).sign(hash_message)

# Receiver (Bob) verifies the signature
verifier = pkcs1_15.new(key.publickey())

try:
    verifier.verify(hash_message, signature)
    print("Digital Signature Verified: Message is Authentic.")
except (ValueError, TypeError):
    print("Digital Signature Verification Failed: Message may have been tampered.")
## Student Name: Venkata Vineetha Gandredu
## Student ID: 1230643650
## Date: 1st November 2023

import hashlib 
def generate_hash(message):
    hash_object = hashlib.sha256(message.encode())
    return hash_object.hexdigest()

# User Input
user_input = input("Enter a message to hash: ")
hash_value = generate_hash(user_input)
print("Hash Value:", hash_value)

from Crypto.PublicKey import RSA
from Crypto.Signature import pkcs1_15
from Crypto.Hash import SHA256

# Generate RSA key pair
key = RSA.generate(2048)

# Sender (Alice) signs the message
message = b"Hello Bob, this message is signed by Alice."
hash_message = SHA256.new(message)
signature = pkcs1_15.new(key).sign(hash_message)

# Receiver (Bob) verifies the signature
verifier = pkcs1_15.new(key.publickey())

try:
    verifier.verify(hash_message, signature)
    print("Digital Signature Verified: Message is Authentic.")
except (ValueError, TypeError):
    print("Digital Signature Verification Failed: Message may have been tampered.")

import hashlib

from Crypto.PublicKey import RSA
from Crypto.Signature import pkcs1_15
from Crypto.Hash import SHA256

# Generate RSA key pair
key = RSA.generate(2048)

# Sender (Alice) signs the message
message = b"Hello Bob, this message is signed by Alice."
hash_message = SHA256.new(message)
signature = pkcs1_15.new(key).sign(hash_message)

# Receiver (Bob) verifies the signature
verifier = pkcs1_15.new(key.publickey())

try:
    verifier.verify(hash_message, signature)
    print("Digital Signature Verified: Message is Authentic.")
except (ValueError, TypeError):
    print("Digital Signature Verification Failed: Message may have been tampered.")
## Student Name: Venkata Vineetha Gandredu
## Student ID: 1230643650
## Date: 1st November 2023

import hashlib 
def generate_hash(message):
    hash_object = hashlib.sha256(message.encode())
    return hash_object.hexdigest()

# User Input
user_input = input("Enter a message to hash: ")
hash_value = generate_hash(user_input)
print("Hash Value:", hash_value)

from Crypto.PublicKey import RSA
from Crypto.Signature import pkcs1_15
from Crypto.Hash import SHA256

# Generate RSA key pair
